DataElement.preferredName: Donor Cellular Infusion Source Other Pheresis Negation Peripheral Blood Stem Cell Collection Timepoint Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation._Where something is available or from where it originates._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._(fer-E-sis) A procedure in which blood is collected, part of the blood such as platelets or white blood cells is taken out, and the rest of the blood is returned to the donor._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._An immature (progenitor) cell circulating in the peripheral blood.  It has the capacity for replication and differentiation to mature blood cells._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation.:Source; where something is available.

Concepts.definition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation.
Where something is available or from where it originates.

Property.preferredName: Other Pheresis Negation PBSC Collection Timepoint
Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:(fer-E-sis) A procedure in which blood is collected, part of the blood such as platelets or white blood cells is taken out, and the rest of the blood is returned to the donor.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Immature cells found circulating in the bloodstream. New blood cells develop from peripheral stem cells.:The act of gathering something together.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A procedure that collects a component of the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
An immature (progenitor) cell circulating in the peripheral blood.  It has the capacity for replication and differentiation to mature blood cells.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the apheresis for the DCI
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the apheresis for the DCI source was done at a different time other than for the collection of PBSC used for the allogeneic HSCT, what was the date of apheresis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2771864
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedProcedure[1].dateRange WHERE PerformedProcedure[1] > DefinedProcedure.nameCode = "Perform apheresis" AND PerformedProcedure[1].dateRange IS NOT EQUAL TO PerformedProcedure[2].dateRange AND PerformedProcedure[2] > DefinedProcedure.nameCode = "Perform collection of PBSC"
